description: Listed only by Irwin, who says: A stop-name that indicates a stopped Flute in most cases, although it is vague in regard to the tone quality. It may be at 8' or 4' on the manuals; this name usually does not appear among the pedal stops. Examples Notwithstanding Irwin's description, the only examples we know of do in fact appear in pedal divisions: Soft Flute 8', 4', Pedal; Royce Hall, University of California, Los Angeles, California, USA; E. M. Skinner, 1930. Soft Flute 8', 4', Pedal; John Wanamaker Store, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA. Bibliography Irwin[1]: Soft Flute. FOOTER Original site compiled by Edward L. Stauff. For educational use only. SoftFlute.html - Last updated 31 May 2000. Home Full Index
